newsitem.title: GERMANY: Canada's Martin-forex misalignments cleared up.
newsitem.headline: Canada's Martin-forex misalignments cleared up.

text.p: Canada's Finance Minister Paul Martin said on Saturday that misalignments among the currencies of the world's seven most industrialised nations, G7, have returned to more normal levels.
"The fact is that the misalignments that we have discussed over the past couple of years have been cleared up," Martin told reporters ahead of a meeting of G7 economic policymakers in Berlin.
"The recent situation is reasonably healthy," he added.
When asked about Canada's economic situation, Martin took an optimistic tone saying: "things are looking very good in Canada. ... We feel quite optimistic about the future."
Martin said there were no plans to change the government's fiscal targets for this year.
The G7 group consists of the United States, Germany, Japan, France, Italy, Canada and Britain.
